snippet: It was the first official claim of responsibility by the group after days of congratulatory messages posted on Twitter by its online supporters.
abstract: Islamic State releases English-language statement claiming Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik, couple that carried out mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif, were members of militant group, referring to them as 'soldiers of the caliphate'; Arabic statement refers to assailants merely as 'supporters'; reason for difference is unclear.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: It was the first official claim of responsibility by the group after days of congratulatory messages posted on Twitter by its online supporters.

headline.main: Islamic State Says ‘Soldiers of Caliphate’ Attacked in San Bernardino
headline.print_headline: ISIS Says ‘Soldiers of Caliphate’ Carried Out Rampage

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
